'''22 May''': In [[Nong Chik District]], [[Pattani Province|Pattani province]], suspected insurgents shot a couple, Mr Pong and Mrs Somchit Khunee-art, killing both of them.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/local/239216/weekly-highlights |title=Weekly highlights |work=Bangkok Post |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}{{DL|date=March 2017}}</ref>
'''24 May''': In [[Tak Bai]], [[Narathiwat Province]], a bomb detonated, killing a policeman and a policewoman while they were distributing food to the local community. Pol Sgt Ubonwan Chindapetch was the first policewoman to die in an explosion in the south.{{CN|date=March 2017}} Meanwhile, in Sai Buri District, Pattani Province, an unknown number of gunmen came and shot Muhammat Stapo, the younger brother of Ismael Rayahlong, a major RKK leader operating in the area who was suspected of the killing of two monks on 17 May.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/238946/teacher-escort-soldier-shot-dead |title=Teacher escort soldier shot dead |work=Bangkok Post |date=26 May 2011 |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}</ref> In [[Krong Pinang District]], [[Yala Province|Yala province]], insurgents shot dead Barudin Sama, assistant village head of Ban Tohbala as he was riding to the tea shop.
'''25 May''': Twelve soldiers from the 13th Regiment in Yala were ambushed by three insurgents, resulting the death of one soldier, private Chuchat Kaeowonghio. A few hours later, a bomb detonated under a [[Humvee]] carrying 20 soldiers, seriously wounding six of them.{{CN|date=March 2017}}
'''27 May''': Police apprehended two RKK leaders in Narathiwat Province.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.goosiam.com/news/html/0023892.html |title=รวบ 2 แกนนำอาร์เคเค ประวัติโชกโชนกว่า10คดี |publisher=Entertainment.goosiam.com |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110720204746/http://entertainment.goosiam.com/news/html/0023892.html |archivedate=20 July 2011 }}</ref>
'''30 May''': A bomb went off in Meung district, [[Yala Province]], wounding five soldiers.
'''31 May''': Two insurgents accidentally detonated a bomb, killing themselves and injuring one other insurgent in Narathiwat Province. One of the dead was identified as Abas Abu, wanted on multiple charges of attacking state officials and multiple bombings. His brother was the insurgent shot dead in February 2011.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.posttoday.com/%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%A1.-%E0%B8%A0%E0%B8%B9%E0%B8%A1%E0%B8%B4%E0%B8%A0%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%84/%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%B1%E0%B9%88%E0%B8%A7%E0%B9%84%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%A2%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%B9%E0%B9%80%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%A2%E0%B9%8C/%E0%B8%9B%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A2%E0%B9%81%E0%B8%AB%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%A1%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%AD%E0%B8%87/91649/%E0%B9%82%E0%B8%88%E0%B8%A3%E0%B9%83%E0%B8%95%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%8B%E0%B8%A7%E0%B8%A2%E0%B8%A7%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%87%E0%B8%A3%E0%B8%B0%E0%B9%80%E0%B8%9A%E0%B8%B4%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%9E%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%95%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A22%E0%B8%A8%E0%B8%9E |title=ข่าวกทม. ข่าวภูมิภาค ข่าวกรุงเทพ ข่าวต่างจังหวัด ชายแดน ข่าวภาคใต้ |work=Post Today |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120320151627/http://www.posttoday.com/%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%A1.-%E0%B8%A0%E0%B8%B9%E0%B8%A1%E0%B8%B4%E0%B8%A0%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%84/%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%B1%E0%B9%88%E0%B8%A7%E0%B9%84%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%A2%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%B9%E0%B9%80%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%A2%E0%B9%8C/%E0%B8%9B%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A2%E0%B9%81%E0%B8%AB%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%A1%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%AD%E0%B8%87/91649/%E0%B9%82%E0%B8%88%E0%B8%A3%E0%B9%83%E0%B8%95%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%8B%E0%B8%A7%E0%B8%A2%E0%B8%A7%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%87%E0%B8%A3%E0%B8%B0%E0%B9%80%E0%B8%9A%E0%B8%B4%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%9E%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%95%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A22%E0%B8%A8%E0%B8%9E |archivedate=20 March 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
'''2 June''': Eight Navy SEALS from Narathiwat Task Force 32 clashed with five RKK insurgents in the [[Tenasserim Hills|Budo Mountain Range]], resulting the death of three insurgents. Two got away. They seized two [[M16 rifle|M16]] assault rifles, one .38 pistol, one land mine, one grenade and over 100 rounds of ammunition. Two of the dead insurgents were identified as senior recruitment members of the RKK while the third was identified as the bomb maker of the group.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/breakingnews/240264/3-militants-killed-weapons-seized |title=3 militants killed in South |work=Bangkok Post |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://manager.co.th/Local/ViewNews.aspx?NewsID=9540000067588 |title=ปะทะเดือดโจรใต้ที่บาเจาะ-ทหารวิสามัญ 3 ศพ |work=Manager |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.norsorpor.com/%E0%B8%82%E0%B9%88%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A7/t2495320/%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%AB%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A3%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%A3%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%AF%E0%B8%84%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%9E%E0%B8%B7%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%B5%E0%B9%88%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%A7%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%9B%E0%B8%B7%E0%B8%99%E0%B9%82%E0%B8%88%E0%B8%A3%E0%B9%83%E0%B8%95%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%95%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A23 |title=นสพ.คอม – ทหารนราฯค้นพื้นที่ดวลปืนโจรใต้ตาย3 |publisher=Norsorpor.com |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110929195518/http://www.norsorpor.com/%E0%B8%82%E0%B9%88%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A7/t2495320/%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%AB%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A3%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%A3%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%AF%E0%B8%84%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%9E%E0%B8%B7%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%B5%E0%B9%88%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%A7%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%9B%E0%B8%B7%E0%B8%99%E0%B9%82%E0%B8%88%E0%B8%A3%E0%B9%83%E0%B8%95%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%95%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A23 |archivedate=29 September 2011 }}</ref>
'''4 June''': Soldiers located two unexploded bombs in the middle of [[Tak Bai|Tak Bai market]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.norsorpor.com/%E0%B8%82%E0%B9%88%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A7/t2497353/%E0%B9%82%E0%B8%8A%E0%B8%84%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%B5%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%B9%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%B1%E0%B8%99!!+%E0%B9%82%E0%B8%88%E0%B8%A3%E0%B9%83%E0%B8%95%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%AD%E0%B8%9A%E0%B8%A7%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%87%E0%B8%A3%E0%B8%B0%E0%B9%80%E0%B8%9A%E0%B8%B4%E0%B8%94+2+%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%B9%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%95%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%B1%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%9A%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%9B%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%B1%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%8A%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%87 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110929195529/http://www.norsorpor.com/%E0%B8%82%E0%B9%88%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A7/t2497353/%E0%B9%82%E0%B8%8A%E0%B8%84%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%B5%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%B9%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%B1%E0%B8%99%21%21%2B%E0%B9%82%E0%B8%88%E0%B8%A3%E0%B9%83%E0%B8%95%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%AD%E0%B8%9A%E0%B8%A7%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%87%E0%B8%A3%E0%B8%B0%E0%B9%80%E0%B8%9A%E0%B8%B4%E0%B8%94%2B2%2B%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%B9%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%95%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%B1%E0%B8%94%E0%B8%9A%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%9B%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%B1%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%8A%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%87 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=29 September 2011 |title=นสพ.คอม – โชคดีกู้ทัน!! โจรใต้ลอบวางระเบิด 2 ลูกตลาดนัดบ้านปลักช้าง |publisher=Norsorpor.com |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
'''25 July''': Five teachers and two security volunteers were wounded in the aftermath of an IED explosion in the Muang District.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/28/2882058_-ct-ct-morning-sweep-250711-.html|title=[CT] CT MORNING SWEEP 250711|date=25 July 2011|accessdate=28 November 2014}}</ref>
'''August''': Fifty-three persons were killed and 75 wounded, in insurgency-related incidents.<ref name="wikileaks.org">{{cite web|url=https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/70/706637_thailand-at-least-53-killed-75-wounded-in-violence-in-south.html|title=At least 53 killed, 75 wounded in violence in south Thailand in August – report |date=4 September 2011|accessdate=19 October 2014}}</ref>
'''1 August''': A roadside bomb killed one and injured two soldiers in the [[Yarang District]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/70/708627_thailand-blast-in-south-thailand-leaves-one-soldier-dead-two.html|title=Blast in south Thailand leaves one soldier dead, two injured |date=2 August 2011|accessdate=19 October 2014}}</ref>
'''August''': Fifty-three persons were killed and 75 wounded, in insurgency-related incidents.<ref name="wikileaks.org"/>
'''13 September''': Thai police confiscated five guns, ammunition, and currency in a house in Narathiwat. Evidence connected the house owner with insurgency organisations.<ref name=Wyt/>
'''14 September''': Insurgents firebombed the Palukasamoh Police Station complex, the building was almost completely destroyed.<ref name=TbV/>
'''15 September''': Five paramilitary rangers were killed and one wounded in a roadside bomb blast, in the Kapho District<ref name=TbV>{{cite web|url=https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/71/713122_thailand-uk-five-paramilitary-soldiers-killed-in-south.html|title=Five paramilitary soldiers killed in south Thailand bombing|date=16 September 2011|accessdate=19 October 2014}}</ref>
'''16 September''': Three bombs exploded on the Charoen Khet Road, Sungai Kolok District. In the aftermath of the incident, four persons were killed and 110 injured, the majority of whom were Malaysian tourists.<ref name=Wyt>{{cite web|url=https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/70/708835_thailand-malaysia-security-forces-give-varying-reasons-for.html|title=Security forces give varying reasons for serial blasts in south Thailand |date=17 September 2011|accessdate=19 October 2014}}</ref>
'''23 September''': A bomb blast seriously wounded a soldier, guarding a school in Rangae District.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/71/718035_thailand-bomb-blast-in-south-thailand-school-injures-soldier.html|title=Bomb blast in south Thailand school injures soldier|date=24 September 2011|accessdate=19 October 2014}}</ref>
'''1 October''': A truck driver was shot and killed in Pattani Province. In Narathiwat Province, Chanae District, a village chief was shot dead. A motorcade of the Southern Border Provinces Administrative Centre secretary-general Panu Uthairat was ambushed by armed men in Pattani, injuring none.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/259199/truck-driver-murdered-in-pattani |title=Truck driver murdered in Pattani |work=Bangkok Post |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/259202/village-chief-killed-in-narathiwat |title=Village chief killed in Narathiwat |work=Bangkok Post |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/259148/armed-men-ambush-centre-motorcade |title=Armed men ambush centre's motorcade |work=Bangkok Post |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}</ref>
'''3 October''': Three persons were shot, two houses were burnt, and a bomb went off near a tank carrying six soldiers in Pattani Province. Police found a hole dug on the Pattani-Yala railway line and said it was in preparation for a bomb attack.<ref name="bangkokpost2">{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/259575/bomb-rocks-central-pattani |title=Bomb rocks central Pattani |work=Bangkok Post |date=4 October 2011 |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}</ref>
'''13 October''': A Mayo District official, along with his driver, were killed when four insurgents attacked them with automatic weapons. One person was killed and one injured by stray bullets in the same incident. Another attack occurred in the Panareh District. Four gunmen attacked a seafood processing business, killing three persons and planting a bomb, later defused by Thai police.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/72/721845_thailand-six-killed-in-insurgent-attacks-in-south-thailand-.html|title=Six killed in insurgent attacks in south Thailand |date=14 October 2011|accessdate=19 October 2014}}</ref>
'''20 October''': A wood trader was shot dead in [[Narathiwat Province]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/262300/wood-trader-murdered-in-narathiwat |title=Wood trader murdered in Narathiwat |work=Bangkok Post |date=20 October 2011 |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}</ref>
'''23 October''': A bomb exploded inside a convenience store on Phichit Bamrung Road, Muang Narathiwat municipality. A second bomb detonated inside a convenience store, located on the Chamroon Nara road, Muang Narathiwat municipality. In a third incident, 10 militants engaged in a firefight with defence volunteers, in Kasoh village, Muang Narathiwat municipality. A total of seven persons were killed and eight injured in the three incidents.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/73/736429_thailand-rok-seven-dead-eight-injured-in-separate-blasts-in.html|title= Seven dead, eight injured in separate blasts in south Thailand|date=25 October 2011|accessdate=19 October 2014}}</ref>
'''25 October''': Ten bombs went off in Meung District, [[Yala Province|Yala province]], killing three persons and injuring 44 others. Two of the dead were insurgents whose bombs accidentally went off when they hit a speed hump. Soldiers defused another 21 bombs. Over 60 insurgents were involved in the attack. Two soldiers were injured in separate attacks in Pattani Province.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/263358/militants-die-transporting-bomb-during-yala-attacks |title=Militants die transporting bomb during Yala attacks |work=Bangkok Post |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}</ref>
'''30 October''': Two men were shot and injured by suspected insurgents in Rueso District, Narathiwat Province.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/263901/two-wounded-in-narathiwat-shooting |title=Two wounded in Narathiwat shooting |work=Bangkok Post |date=30 October 2011 |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}</ref>
'''31 October''': Ten bombs went off in five districts across Narathiwat Province, injuring none. However, suspected insurgents shot dead two people at a petrol station and a third at a nearby grocery shop. In Yala Province, a police corporal was wounded in an explosion.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/263958/ten-bombs-go-off-in-narathiwat |title=Ten bombs go off in Narathiwat |work=Bangkok Post |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/264036/policeman-wounded-in-yala-explosion |title=Policeman hurt in Yala explosion |work=Bangkok Post |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}</ref>
'''2 November''': In Yala Province, a 20 kg bomb went off, injuring two police border patrol officers of the Yala 44 regiment, and seriously injuring another.{{CN|date=March 2017}}
'''3 November''': In Narathiwat Province, a 50-man police-military joint force arrested an insurgent who confessed to planting a bomb in Narathiwat on 30 October.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/breakingnews/264542/narathiwat-bomb-suspect-arrested |title=Narathiwat bomb suspect arrested |work=Bangkok Post |date= |accessdate=3 November 2011 }}</ref> While in the Ra-ngae District, six hunters were killed and one seriously injured when insurgents blew up their truck. Later that day, six military personnel were injured in the same region.{{CN|date=March 2017}}
'''4 November''': An unknown number of insurgents fired M-79 grenades at a military checkpoint, seriously injuring a passerby, {{Not a typo|Tiem}} Bangkeaw in Pattani Province. In Narathiwat Province, a joint military-defense volunteer task force apprehended two suspected insurgents carrying a shotgun and a 9 mm pistol.{{CN|date=March 2017}}
'''14 November''': A rubber tapper was killed by rebels at his workplace, in Narathiwat Province.{{CN|date=March 2017}}
'''16 November''': Nine bombs exploded in the Muang, Yaring, and Yarang Districts. In the Nong Chik District, a military outpost came under assault rifle fire. In the Panare District, rebels attacked with grenades. In the aftermath of the attacks, only minor damage was recorded.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/75/757256_thailand-us-nine-blasts-shooting-incidents-reported-from.html|publisher=WikiLeaks|title=Nine blasts, shooting incidents reported from south Thailand; no casualties|date=18 November 2011|accessdate=19 October 2014}}</ref>
'''20 November''': In Narathiwat Province, a 50-man [[Thahan Phran]] unit from the 46th regiment got into a 30-minute gunfight with four to five groups of RKK insurgents, resulting the death of a key leader of the RKK. He had a bounty of over one million baht on his head and was responsible for numerous attacks, including one on the same regiment a year ago. Two other insurgents were captured as well.{{CN|date=March 2017}}
'''21 November''': An explosive device detonated outside a laundry shop on Charoen Pradit Road, Pattani, injuring nine people. Another bomb injured six policemen escorting monks in the Muang District. Insurgents blew up power poles in the Than To District.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/76/767167_thailand-uk-nine-injured-in-south-thailand-bomb-blast-.html|title=Nine injured in south Thailand bomb blast|publisher=WikiLeaks |date=22 November 2011|accessdate=19 October 2014}}</ref>
'''1 December''': A police task force apprehended a RKK insurgent instructor in the Yarang District of the Yala province. Meanwhile, a soldier, Private Kriangkrai Pornhormfai, was killed after stepping on a mine, and another, Siam Sealao, was seriously wounded.{{CN|date=March 2017}}
'''5 December''': A 40-man [[Thahan Phran]] unit of the 45th regiment apprehended three suspected insurgents. A shotgun, along with drugs, were confiscated in the process. The arrest occurred in Narathiwat Province.{{CN|date=March 2017}}
===2012=== '''1 February''': A [[Thahan Phran]], Thanong Sinthu, was shot in [[Pattani Province]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/277809/ranger-slain-in-pattani |title=Ranger slain in Pattani |work=Bangkok Post |date= |accessdate=30 November 2012}}</ref>
'''3 February''': An illegal oil trader was shot in [[Bacho District]], [[Narathiwat Province]]. In a separate incident in [[Pattani Province]] a woman was killed and her husband and son were injured. Deep South Watch announced 33 dead and 55 injured in January as a result of clashes in south Thailand, with no insurgent casualties.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/breakingnews/278132/one-killed-2-wounded-in-pattani-shooting |title=Wife slain, husband, son wounded |work=Bangkok Post |date=3 February 2012 |accessdate=30 November 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/breakingnews/278146/oil-vendor-murdered-in-narathiwat |title=Oil trader murdered in Narathiwat|work=Bangkok Post |date=3 February 2012 |accessdate=30 November 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/breakingnews/278172/33-killed-in-far-south-unrest-in-january |title=33 killed in far South in January|work=Bangkok Post |date=3 February 2012 |accessdate=30 November 2012}}</ref>
'''4 February''': A truck driver, Mahama Yakee, was shot in [[Pattani Province]] early in the morning.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/278305/truck-driver-slain-in-pattani |title=Truck driver slain in Pattani|work=Bangkok Post|accessdate=14 October 2014 }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}</ref>
'''21 February''': In [[Panare District]], [[Pattani Province]], three insurgents were killed after they clashed with the 44th regiment Thahan Phran, while three rangers were injured and two [[AK-47]] rifles were seized. In [[Rueso District]], [[Narathiwat Province]], a former [[Patani United Liberation Organisation|PULO]] leader was shot dead at his home. He has been known to have been approached by many RKK members to join their cause but he refused. Finally, in [[Si Sakhon District]], [[Narathiwat Province]], a 100-man [[Thahan Phran]] unit from the 46th regiment clashed with around 10 insurgents resulting in one ranger, Sgt Rithidej Sriruangdej, seriously wounded, and key insurgent, wanted for many arrest warrants, killed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/280851/southern-insurgents-slain |title=Insurgents shot dead in far South|work=Bangkok Post |date=21 February 2012 |accessdate=30 November 2012}}</ref>
'''28 February''': In [[Raman District]], [[Yala Province]], soldiers from the 12th special task force clashed with three insurgents, resulting the death of a key insurgent wanted on multiple charges and the apprehension of another insurgent.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/breakingnews/281994/militant-slain-in-yala-shooting/ |title=Militant killed in Yala shootout|work=Bangkok Post |date= |accessdate=30 November 2012}}</ref>
'''5 March''': A blast at a market in the [[Tak Bai District]] wounded eight.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nst.com.my/latest/market-blast-wounds-8-in-thailand-s-restive-south-1.55965 |title=Market blast wounds 8 in Thailand's restive south |work=[[New Straits Times]] |date=5 March 2012 |accessdate=28 March 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120306203732/http://www.nst.com.my/latest/market-blast-wounds-8-in-thailand-s-restive-south-1.55965 |archivedate=6 March 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/156507/market-blast-wounds-8-in-thailands-restive-south|title=Market blast wounds 8 in Thailand's restive south|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=5 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}}</ref>
'''7 March''': Four soldiers and a [[Rubber tapping|rubber tapper]] were killed in two separate attacks in [[Narathiwat Province|Narathiwat]] and [[Pattani Province]]s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/283475/5-killed-in-south-army-rejects-pattani-city|title=5 killed in South, army rejects Pattani zone|publisher=''[[Bangkok Post]]''|date=8 March 2012|accessdate=9 March 2012}}</ref> Two days later at least 50 militants attacked an army base in [[Yala Province]], shooting electricity poles down to block escape routes, kidnapping 2 soldiers and injuring 12 more. The missing officers were later discovered shot to death with their hands bound and their weapons gone.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.trust.org/alertnet/news/militants-kill-2-soldiers-wound-12-in-thai-south-attacks/ |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120914030304/http://www.trust.org/alertnet/news/militants-kill-2-soldiers-wound-12-in-thai-south-attacks/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=14 September 2012 |title=Militants kill 2 soldiers, wound 12 in Thai south attacks |publisher=Trust.org |date=3 September 2012 |accessdate=3 September 2012 }}</ref>
'''10 March''': A local [[politician]] was shot dead by an [[M16 rifle|M-16 assault rifle]] and [[9 mm caliber|9 mm pistol]] in Pattani's Ka Por District by a group of four or five assailants in a [[Sedan (automobile)|sedan]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.asiaone.com/News/AsiaOne%2BNews/Asia/Story/A1Story20120311-332785.html|title=Thai politician shot dead in Pattani, Narawathi|work=[[AsiaOne]]|date=11 March 2012|accessdate=11 March 2012}}</ref>
'''12 March''': Two soldiers were wounded by a bomb explosion while providing security for teachers in [[Pattani Province|Pattani]]'s [[Sai Buri District]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nationmultimedia.com/national/Two-soldiers-seriously-injured-in-Pattani-ambush-30177748.html|title=Two soldiers seriously injured in Pattani ambush|work=The Nation|date=12 March 2012|accessdate=13 March 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/breakingnews/283999/two-soldiers-killed-by-bomb-in-pattani|title=Two soldiers hurt by bomb in Pattani|work=Bangkok Post|date=12 March 2012|accessdate=13 March 2012}}</ref> In [[Yarang District]], an unknown number of persons set afire the office of the Rawaeng Sub-district Tambon Administration Organisation.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/284075/fire-breaks-out-as-army-moves-outpost-blast-hurts-2-soldiers|title=Fire breaks out as army moves outpost; blast hurts 2 soldiers|work=Bangkok Post|date=13 March 2012|accessdate=13 March 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcot.net/cfcustom/cache_page/340742.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120904175824/http://www.mcot.net/cfcustom/cache_page/340742.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=4 September 2012 |title=Two soldiers wounded in Pattani ambush bombing |work=MCOT |date= |accessdate=13 March 2012 }}</ref>
'''15 March''': A motorcycle bomb exploded in Pattani, killing one villager and wounding three others including two soldiers.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nationmultimedia.com/national/Pattani-explosion-kills-one-injures-three-others-30178082.html|title=Pattani explosion kills one, injures three others|work=The Nation|date=16 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}}</ref>
'''17 March''': A school girl was killed and four others injured, two critically, in a [[Improvised explosive device|roadside bomb]] attack apparently intended for soldiers in Pattani.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/breakingnews/284802/pattani-bomb-kills-schoolgirl|title=Pattani bomb kills schoolgirl|work=Bangkok Post|date=17 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}}</ref>
'''19 March''': A member of a village security team was shot dead in [[Pattani Province|Pattani]]'s [[Yaring District]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/local/285011/villager-slain-in-pattani|title=Villager slain in Pattani|work=Bangkok Post|date=19 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nationmultimedia.com/national/Volunteer-shot-dead-in-Pattani;-bomb-defused-in-Na-30178306.html|title=Volunteer shot dead in Pattani; bomb defused in Narathiwat|work=The Nation|date=20 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}}</ref>
'''21 March''': The [[Royal Thai Army|Thai army]] has accepted responsibility for killing four innocent [[civilian]]s in the insurgency-plagued south two months ago.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2012/03/21/thai-army-accepts-blame-killing-4-civilians.html |title=Thai army accepts blame for killing 4 civilians |work=[[The Jakarta Post]] |date=21 March 2012 |accessdate=28 March 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120323093311/http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2012/03/21/thai-army-accepts-blame-killing-4-civilians.html |archivedate=23 March 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mcot.net/cfcustom/cache_page/344533.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120917125906/http://www.mcot.net/cfcustom/cache_page/344533.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=17 September 2012 |title=Army rangers kill four Pattani villagers: Region 4 commander |work=[[MCOT]] |date=21 March 2012 |accessdate=28 March 2012 }}</ref>
'''25 March''': An assistant village head in [[Narathiwat Province|Narathiwat]] and a defence volunteer in Pattani were killed in [[drive-by shooting]]s.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/local/285983/gunmen-kill-two-in-south|title=Gunmen kill two in South|work=Bangkok Post|date=26 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}}</ref> A policeman was shot dead by [[Insurgent|militants]] in Pattani's [[Yarang District]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/286055/police-killed-in-pattani|title=Policeman killed in Pattani|work=Bangkok Post|date=26 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}}</ref>
'''29 March''': A [[security guard]] was killed in a [[drive-by shooting]] in Pattani's Muang District.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/breakingnews/286536/security-guard-slain-in-pattani|title=Security guard slain in Pattani|work=Bangkok Post|date=29 March 2012|accessdate=30 March 2012}}</ref>
'''31 March''': [[2012 Southern Thailand bombings|Four bombs exploded]] in Yala shopping districts and the parking lot of a hotel in [[Hat Yai]], killing 16 and injuring more than 300 others.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/mar/31/thailand-bomb-blasts-yala?newsfeed=true|title=Three deadly bomb blasts hit Yala in southern Thailand|work=The Guardian|date=31 March 2012|accessdate=31 March 2012|location=London|first=Damien|last=Pearse}}</ref>
'''3 April''': A police officer from the Muang Pattani police station was seriously wounded by a gunman at a [[Pier|fishing pier]] in Moo 6 of tambon Samilae in Pattani's Muang District.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/local/287270/police-wounded-in-pattani-shooting|title=Police officer shot, wounded in Pattani|work=Bangkok Post|date=3 April 2012|accessdate=6 April 2012}}</ref>
'''4 April''': Two men on a motorcycle hurled a [[grenade]] at a [[PTT Public Company Limited|PTT gas station]] at Ban Pongsata in Pattani's [[Yarang District]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/local/287410/bomb-attack-in-pattani-no-one-hurt|title=Grenade blast in Pattani, no injuries|work=Bangkok Post|date=4 April 2012|accessdate=6 April 2012}}</ref>
'''5 April''': A car care shop owner was killed and his son seriously injured in a shooting in Pattani's [[Yaring District]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/local/287613/car-care-shop-owner-slain-in-pattani|title=Car care shop owner slain in Pattani|work=Bangkok Post|date=5 April 2012|accessdate=6 April 2012}}</ref>
'''11 April''': Three villagers were killed when gunmen opened fire at them as they were leaving a mosque in Pattani's [[Panare District]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/288566/3-villagers-slain-in-pattani|title=Three slain leaving Pattani mosque|work=Bangkok Post|date=12 April 2012|accessdate=15 April 2012}}</ref>
'''13 April''': Five passengers were wounded when gunmen on motorcycles attacked a bus in Pattani's [[Sai Buri District]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/288717/pattani-bus-attack-wounds-5|title=Pattani bus attack wounds 5|work=Bangkok Post|date=13 April 2012|accessdate=15 April 2012}}</ref>
'''15 April''': Police seized large numbers of weapons including four M16 assault rifles in [[Sai Buri District]], [[Pattani Province]].<ref name="Naewna">{{cite web|url=http://www.naewna.com/local/4370|title=โจรใต้ตอบโต้จนท.รัฐ บึ้มนราฯ2จุด ทหารพรานเจ็บ5นาย ยะลาล่าอีก9อาร์เคเค|work=Naewna|date=20 April 2012|accessdate=20 April 2012}}{{Failed verification|date=March 2017}}</ref>
'''19 April''': A 100-man unit clashed with a 14 insurgents in [[Yala Province]], resulting the death of five insurgents. The others managed to escape.<ref>{{vi}} [http://www.nguoi-viet.com/absolutenm2/templates/viewarticlesNVO.aspx?articleid=147634&zoneid=5 Năm phiến quân bị giết tại Nam Thái Lan] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402124922/http://www.nguoi-viet.com/absolutenm2/templates/viewarticlesNVO.aspx?articleid=147634&zoneid=5 |date=2 April 2015 }}</ref> After some forensic work, it was revealed that one of the dead insurgents was a leader wanted on over seven charges. Meanwhile, in [[Narathiwat Province]], a 30-man [[Thahan Phran]] unit from the 45th regiment apprehended two RKK members wanted for shooting two teachers in 2010. In a separate incident, a bomb detonated, injuring five soldiers in the same province.<ref name="Naewna"/>
'''22 April''': An insurgent was shot dead by combined police and [[Thahan Phran]] forces after resisting arrest in [[Rueso District]], [[Narathiwat Province]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/breakingnews/289889/one-rkk-member-killed-in-narathiwat|title=RKK member killed in Narathiwat|work=Bangkok Post|date=22 April 2012|accessdate=22 April 2012}}</ref>
'''24 April''': Village chief Sainung Ada was shot dead in [[Narathiwat Province]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nationmultimedia.com/national/Village-head-shot-dead-in-Narathiwat-30180593.html|title=Village head shot dead in Narathiwat |work=The Nation|date=24 April 2012|accessdate=24 April 2012}}</ref> In [[Tak Bai District]], a bomb detonated injuring three civilians and five soldiers. A 5-year-old boy was among the injured.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/breakingnews/290229/8-wounded-by-bomb-in-tak-bai|title=8 wounded by bomb in Tak Bai|work=Bangkok Post|date=24 April 2012|accessdate=24 April 2012}}</ref>
'''23 July''': A rubber tapper, Prinya Sinbut, was shot twice in the body and once in the arm, and is seriously wounded in [[Mae Lan District]], [[Pattani Province]].{{cn|date=March 2017}}
'''25 July''': After a warning that insurgents would intensify attacks during [[Ramadan]], five anti-drug officers were killed and one seriously injured in a car bomb in [[Raman District]]. Authorities believe it was in retaliation for recent drug suspect arrests.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/304290/five-anti-drug-officerskilled-in-yala-car-bomb|title=Five anti-drug officers killed in Yala car bomb |work=Bangkok Post|date=26 July 2012|accessdate=30 July 2012}}</ref>
'''26 July''': Two men, Seng Changkid, and Kittisak Chamnanlee were slain after they left their house in [[Bannang Sata District]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/304414/two-villagers-slain-in-yala|title=Two villagers slain in Yala|work=Bangkok Post|date=26 July 2012|accessdate=30 July 2012}}</ref> and an assistant village headman, Haree Vaebuesar, was shot dead in an ambush in [[Raman District]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/304376/asst-village-chief-slain-in-yala |work=Bangkok Post|date=26 July 2012 |title=Asst village chief slain in Yala |accessdate=31 July 2012}}</ref> All three events occurred in [[Yala Province]].
'''28 July''': Four soldiers were killed in an ambush by 16 militants.<ref name="BP-20120730">{{cite news|title=Forces scour South for attackers|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/archive/forces-scour-south-for-attackers/304923|accessdate=12 March 2017|work=Bangkok Post|date=30 July 2012}}</ref>
'''29 July''': Five civilians, all around [[Yala Province]], were shot dead by insurgents.<ref name="BP-20120730"/> In addition, four soldiers were wounded in an attack in the same province.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.matichon.co.th/news_detail.php?newsid=1343610308&grpid=&catid=19&subcatid=1906 |title=ใต้ป่วนอีก! คนร้ายซุกบึ้มกระถางต้นไม้ ตชด. ชุดลาดตระเวน ยะลา เจ็บ 4: มติชนออนไลน์ |work=Matichon |accessdate=30 November 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130801074834/http://www.matichon.co.th/news_detail.php?newsid=1343610308&grpid=&catid=19&subcatid=1906 |archivedate= 1 August 2013 |df= }}</ref>
'''11 September''': Over 100 insurgents, including a leader, Jae A-Lee, from the group Badan Penyelarasan Wawasan Baru Melayu Patani, surrendered to military authorities, demanding justice in exchange for halting the insurgency. Jae A-Lee also claimed that two other core leaders are in the process of submitting to the military. Jae A-Lee's one million baht bounty, as a result of the deaths of four soldiers on 4 January, has also been whitewashed.<ref>[http://www.komchadluek.net/detail/20120911/139839/%E0%B9%81%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%B3%E0%B8%9B%E0%B9%88%E0%B8%A7%E0%B8%99%E0%B9%83%E0%B8%95%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%B3%E0%B8%AA%E0%B8%A1%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%8A%E0%B8%B4%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%B1%E0%B8%9A%E0%B8%A3%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%AD%E0%B8%A2%E0%B8%A1%E0%B8%AD%E0%B8%9A%E0%B8%95%E0%B8%B1%E0%B8 %A7.html#.UE9A0lGv] {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref>
===2013=== According to the region's Internal Security Operations Command, there were 320 bombings in the four border provinces between January and December 2013, compared with 276 reported bombings in 2012.<ref name="ibtimes.co.uk">{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/thailand-policemans-wife-shot-dead-set-fire-revenge-attack-1435809|title=Thailand: Policeman's Wife Shot Dead and Set on Fire in Revenge Attack|work=International Business Times UK|accessdate=14 October 2014}}</ref> Experts alleged that the rise in deaths was linked to the stalling of peace talks while [[Yingluck Shinawatra]]'s government faced [[2013–14 Thai political crisis|anti-government protests]] in Bangkok and court proceedings against it over corruption.
'''10 February''': Insurgents killed five soldiers and wounded five others in two roadside bomb attacks in Yala Province. According to Thai military officials, in the first attack militants detonated a car bomb as a truck carrying six soldiers passed by. Then they opened fire on the soldiers killing five of them, and taking away the dead soldiers' rifles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dawn.com/2013/02/11/five-thai-soldiers-killed-in-attack/ |title=Five Thai soldiers killed in attack |publisher=Dawn.com |accessdate=14 October 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140116110236/http://www.dawn.com/2013/02/11/five-thai-soldiers-killed-in-attack/ |archivedate=16 January 2014 }}</ref>
'''13 February''': At least 17 Muslim insurgents including a commander were killed during an attack on a military base in Narathiwat. None of the Thai military defenders of the base were hurt.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/02/13/us-thailand-violence-south-idUSBRE91C07V20130213|title=17 die in clash|agency=Reuters|date=13 February 2013}}</ref>
'''12 April''': Two soldiers were killed and six others wounded in a road side bombing. Suspected militants detonated an improvised bomb hidden on the road surface in Pattani Province's [[Panarae District]]. The soldiers were in two armoured vehicles travelling to inspect damages from an earlier militant attack. One of the personnel carriers was badly damaged.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chinapost.com.tw/asia/thailand/2013/04/12/375794/2-soldiers.htm|title=2 soldiers killed, 6 wounded by bomb in south Thailand|publisher=China Post|accessdate=14 October 2014}}</ref>
'''26 April''': Four soldiers were killed and another four seriously injured while attempting to defuse a bomb. According to Thai authorities, the blast happened after troops moved the device which was hidden under a gas tank and placed under a bridge near the Narathiwat military base. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asiapacific/four-soldiers-killed-while-defusing-bomb/647494.html |accessdate=22 March 2015 |deadurl=yes |title=Four soldiers killed while defusing bomb |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130424190003/http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asiapacific/four-soldiers-killed-while-defusing-bomb/647494.html |archivedate=24 April 2013 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
'''1 May''': Police say suspected insurgents have killed six people including a two-year-old boy in Thailand's south. <ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2013/05/01/6-killed-in-shooting-in-thailand-insurgency-plagued-south/ | work=Fox News | title=6 killed in shooting in Thailand's insurgency-plagued south | date=1 May 2013}}</ref>
Peace talks were also started in Kuala Lumpur in February at the behest of Malaysia. Barisan Revolusi Nasional's Hassan Taib led the talks, while the Thai government team was led by Secretary-General of the National Security Council Lieutenant General Paradon Pattanatabut. However, the exiled leader of the Pattani United Liberation Organisation, Kasturi Mahkota, said attacks by his group would continue if they were not invited to the talks. For his part, Pattanatabut said that Thailand would not agree to independence or any contravention of the [[constitution of Thailand]], but would seek to discuss degrees of autonomy and an amnesty with the rebels.<ref name="aljazeera.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/programmes/101east/2013/06/2013626115439264456.html|title=Into the south|author=101 East|work=Al Jazeera|accessdate=14 October 2014}}</ref>
'''21 June''': Two persons were killed and five others were wounded in three separate assaults in Yala and Pattani provinces.<ref>{{cite web|title=Two killed, five wounded in three southern attacks|url=http://www.pattayamail.com/thailandnews/two-killed-five-wounded-in-three-southern-attacks-27427|publisher=Pattaya Mail|date=21 June 2013}}</ref>
===2014=== '''9 February''': A policeman's wife was shot dead and then set on fire in front of a crowd at a busy market in Pattani. The woman, 28, was shot down on the afternoon of 9 February as she returned to her car from a market in the Ratapanyang area of Pattani Province. After being shot, the woman's body was set alight. The attack was allegedly carried out in revenge for the deaths of three Muslim brothers, aged three, five and nine, that took place during the week of 2 February. The boys were shot in front of their home in neighbouring Narathiwat Province. Their pregnant mother and father were also shot in the attack but survived. Srisompob Jitpiromsri, at Prince of Songkhla University in Pattani, said the boys' deaths "have set off a chain-reaction which will be hard to control unless authorities can bring to justice their killers". "The insurgent movement is taking their deaths as an opportunity for revenge. Local feelings over this are running very high," he said.<ref name="ibtimes.co.uk"/>
'''14 March''': Siriporn Srichai, a female schoolteacher, was shot dead and her body was burned in Mayo District of Pattani Province.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thailandnews.co/2014/03/woman-teacher-shot-dead-in-pattani-body-burned/|title=Thailand News – Woman teacher shot dead in Pattani, body burned|work=Thailand News|accessdate=28 November 2014}}</ref>
'''24 May''': Three people were killed and about 80 injured in 13 bomb blasts at at least five 7/Eleven stores and two gas stations.{{cn|date=March 2017}}
'''28 May''': Violence continued in Pattani as a bomb blast at a hospital car park injured 10 people including a soldier. Those injured included Pvt Phonlawat Nonthasen. The most seriously wounded in attacks that have left two dead and more than 70 wounded was a three-year-old girl, Vaesiteeaija Vaelong maimed for life when doctors had to amputate the remains of her right leg after it was mangled by the blast.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/412370/pattani-hospital-blast-injures-10|title=Pattani hospital blast injures 10|work=Bangkok Post|accessdate=14 October 2014}}</ref>
'''28 August''': Patimoh Saemaesae, a female schoolteacher, was killed and another teacher and a policeman were wounded in a bomb attack directed at the teachers and their police escort in [[Khok Pho District]] of Pattani Province.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nationmultimedia.com/breakingnews/Female-teacher-killed-another-injured-along-with-p-30241949.html|title=Female teacher killed, another injured along with police in Pattani blast|date=28 August 2014|work=The Nation|accessdate=28 November 2014}}</ref>
'''5 September''': A paramilitary volunteer's attempt to portray an unarmed 14-year-old Muslim boy falsely as an armed insurgent after killing him has come under investigation by the junta.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/local/430685/paramilitary-framed-teen-he-killed|title=Paramilitary framed teen he killed|work=Bangkok Post|accessdate=14 October 2014}}</ref>
'''12 October''': A total of six schools were destroyed by fire in six coordinated arson attacks in [[Thung Yang Daeng District|Thung Yang Daeng]] and Mayo Districts of Pattani Province;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/437217/six-schools-torched-in-pattani|title=Six schools torched in Pattani|work=Bangkok Post|accessdate=12 October 2014}}</ref> some of the arsonists were subsequently arrested and confessed that their intention had been to set fire to 14 schools, but residents had managed to contact the authorities before they could carry out more arson attacks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/438724/police-nab-8-suspects-for-pattani-school-torchings|title=Police hold 8 for Pattani school fires|work=Bangkok Post|accessdate=21 October 2014}}</ref>
'''4 November''': The military decides to arm civilian groups by distributing thousands of [[assault rifle]]s allegedly to help civilians to fight against the public order disturbing outfits. Human rights groups have protested against this measure, which in their eyes will only make the situation worse.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-29892629|title=Thai military distributes rifles to fight insurgents in south|work=BBC News|accessdate=28 November 2014}}</ref>
'''29 November''': Katesaya Muenkoto, a 29-year-old woman died of bullet wounds in Khok Pho District in Pattani Province. She and a man were shot at while they were buying meat from a shop in the early morning. The attacker was driving a motorcycle and shot at them six times, hitting the woman in the head and the man in the back.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/446136/woman-dies-in-pattani-shooting|work=Bangkok Post|title=Woman dies in Pattani shooting|date=29 November 2014|author=Abdulloh Benjakat|accessdate=13 May 2016}}</ref>
===2015=== '''9 January''': Three insurgents were slain and two others detained, as security forces raided a religious school in [[Mayo District]], Pattani Province.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/455683/three-insurgents-killed-in-pattani|title=Three insurgents killed in Pattani raid|work=Bangkok Post|author=Abdulloh Benjakat|date=9 January 2015|accessdate=25 March 2015}}</ref>
'''13 January''': A motorcycle bomb exploded damaging the vehicle carrying the [[Chanae District]] chief of Narathiwat Province. The officer and the other four occupants of the vehicle escaped unhurt.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/456808/district-chief-survives-narathiwat-bomb|title=District chief survives Narathiwat bomb|work=Bangkok Post|author=Waedao Harai|date=14 January 2015|accessdate=13 April 2015}}</ref>
'''19 January''': A bomb planted in a drain exploded in Narathiwat town while a convoy of vehicles escorting teachers was passing by in Ban Buecho village, [[Bacho District]], Narathiwat Province, in the morning. One teacher was wounded.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/general/458020/escorted-teacher-convoy-bombed-in-narathiwat|title=Bomb injures teacher in Narathiwat|author=Waedao Harai|work=Bangkok Post|date=19 January 2015|accessdate=13 May 2016}}</ref>
'''31 January''': A militant ambush conducted on the Pattani-Hat Yai road resulted in the death of a senior police officer; three police were also wounded.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/462768/gunmen-shoot-dead-senior-cop-in-pattani|title=Gunmen shoot dead senior cop in Pattani|work=Bangkok Post|date=31 January 2015|authors=Wassana Nanuam and Patsara Jikkham|accessdate=25 March 2015}}</ref>
'''4 February''': A 25 kg gas-cylinder bomb exploded in Chanae District, Narathiwat Province, as a truck carrying ten police officers was passing by. All policemen escaped unhurt.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/467322/police-survive-narathiwat-bomb-attack|work=Bangkok Post|title=Police survive Narathiwat bomb attack|author=Waedao Harai|accessdate=13 May 2016}}</ref>
'''19 February''': A series of car and motorcycle bombs exploded in Narathiwat town. Thirteen persons were wounded and at least 20 buildings were damaged. One of the string of bombs planted failed to explode.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/480052/car-bombs-hurt-10-in-narathiwat|work=Bangkok Post|title=Car, motorcycle bombs injure 13 in Narathiwat|author=Waedao Harai|accessdate=13 May 2016}}</ref>
'''1 March''': A large–scale security operation took place in the districts of Pak Phanang, Cha-uat, Thung Song, Chian Yai, Nop Phitam, Tha Sala, Phipun, Muang, Ron Phibun, and Chulabhorn. It resulted in the seizure of 35 weapons, 1,041 rounds of ammunition, and 265 [[methamphetamine]] pills.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/485810/guns-ammo-seized-in-south-raids|title=Guns, ammo seized in South raids|work=Bangkok Post|date=1 March 2015|accessdate=25 March 2015}}</ref>
'''2 March''': A military spokesman stated that the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd Armies will begin withdrawing from the Pattani, Yala, and Narathiwat Provinces in April. The move came as part of the ongoing peace negotiations between the rebels and the government.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/486732/troop-withdrawals-from-south-in-april|title=Troop withdrawals from South in April|work=Bangkok Post|date=2 March 2015|accessdate=25 March 2015}}</ref>
'''20 March''': A 25 kg gas-cylinder bomb exploded by the roadside in Ban Khok village, Tambon Chuap, [[Cho-airong District]], Narathiwat Province, when a police vehicle passed by. The two officers escaped unhurt.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/503890/police-survive-narathiwat-blast|work=Bangkok Post|title=Police survive Narathiwat blast|author=Waedao Harai|date=2015-03-21|accessdate=13 May 2016}}</ref>
'''30 March''': A homemade bomb exploded by the roadside in Rueso District, Narathiwat Province, as a police patrol team passed by. Two officers were injured.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/general/513598/bomb-hurts-two-policemen-in-narathiwat|work=Bangkok Post|title=Bomb hurts two policemen in Narathiwat|author=Waedao Harai|date=31 March 2015|accessdate=13 May 2016}}</ref>
'''1 April''': Four bombs exploded in the centre of Pattani town in the early morning hours causing material damage, but no casualties.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/516279/four-bombs-rock-pattani|work=Bangkok Post|title=Four bombs rock Pattani|date=2 April 2015|accessdate=13 May 2016}}</ref>
'''2 April''': Two unidentified men were murdered by gunmen while hunting in [[Rangae District]], Narathiwat Province. They were attacked and their guns were stolen while they were carrying home a [[wild boar]] they had killed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/crime/516311/two-hunters-slain-in-narathiwat|work=Bangkok Post|title=Two hunters slain in Narathiwat|date=2 April 2015|accessdate=13 May 2016}}</ref>
'''4 April''': Two bombs exploded in Narathiwat Province, one in [[Chanae District]] and the other in Cho-airong District. The first one was a gas-cylinder bomb planted next to the Chang Phueak tambon administration. The other targeted paramilitary rangers in Luborya village. Their vehicle was damaged, but the officers escaped unhurt.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/518171/officers-escape-narathiwat-blasts|work=Bangkok Post|author=Waedao Harai|title=Officers escape Narathiwat blasts|date=4 April 2015|accessdate=13 May 2016}}</ref>
===2016=== '''13 March''': A group of armed and masked insurgents took over Joh Airong Hospital in Narathiwat Province.<ref>{{cite web|title=Thailand: Insurgents Seize Hospital in South|url=https://www.hrw.org/news/2016/03/15/thailand-insurgents-seize-hospital-south|accessdate=13 March 2017|publisher=Human Rights Watch|date=2016-03-15}}</ref>
'''6 June''': A village chief and his assistant was killed by suspected insurgents in Narathiwat Province.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://muslimnews.co.uk/news/south-east-asia/thailand-village-chief-assistant-killed-muslim-south/|title=Thailand: Village chief, assistant killed in Muslim South|last=|first=|date=8 June 2016|website=Muslim News|publisher=|access-date=18 June 2016}}</ref>
'''5 July''': Several attacks occurred during Ramadan.<ref name="IyengarThailandRamadanAttacks">{{cite news|last1=Iyengar|first1=Rishi|title=Latest in the Spate of Worldwide Ramadan Attacks: Thailand|url=http://time.com/4392879/thailand-pattani-bomb-ramadan-terrorism/|accessdate=5 July 2016|work=Time|date=5 July 2016}}</ref><ref name="ThaiRamadanBombings">{{cite news|title=Series of bombings in south Thailand mark Ramadan end|url=http://news.asiaone.com/news/asia/series-bombings-south-thailand-mark-ramadan-end|accessdate=5 July 2016|publisher=[[AsiaOne]]|date=5 July 2016}}</ref>
'''6 September''': A bomb attack in front of a school in [[Tak Bai]], Narathiwat, kills two and injures eight persons.<ref>{{cite news|title=Two killed and eight injured in bomb attack in Narathiwat|url=http://englishnews.thaipbs.or.th/two-killed-eight-injured-bomb-attack-narathiwat/|accessdate=13 March 2017|work=Thai PBS|date=2016-09-06}}</ref>
'''2-3 November''': Coordinated bomb-and-gun attacks in Thailand's strife-torn southern region in Pattani Province have left at least three people dead. The attacks late on 2 November and early the next day appeared to be in retaliation for stepped-up security operations taken against insurgents and were not aimed at the monarchy.<ref>{{cite web|last=Chaichalearmmongkol |first=Nopparat |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/insurgent-attacks-in-southern-thailand-kill-at-least-three-1478151949 |title=Insurgent Attacks in Southern Thailand Kill at Least Three |work=The Wall Street Journal |date= |accessdate=2016-11-04}}</ref>
'''4 November''': One man was shot dead in [[Waeng District]], another in the [[Rueso District]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/1127221/two-men-shot-dead-in-narathiwat |title=Two men shot dead in Narathiwat|work=Bangkok Post|date= |accessdate=2016-11-14}}</ref>
'''1 December''': One soldier was killed and three others were injured in an early morning explosion in Thailand's Muslim majority south in [[Yala Province]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://muslimnews.co.uk/news/south-east-asia/thailand-soldier-killed-3-injured-bomb-attack-south/ |title=Thailand: Soldier killed, 3 injured in bomb attack in south |work=Muslim News |date=2016-12-01 |accessdate=2016-12-06}}</ref>
'''6 December''': Suspected insurgents shot dead six people in a series of attacks carried out in Thailand's deep south in the provinces of Pattani and Narathiwat.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.benarnews.org/english/news/thai/deepsouth-deaths-12072016152217.html|title=Six People Shot Dead in Thai Deep South|work=Benar News|date=2016-12-07|accessdate=17 January 2017}}</ref>
'''11 December''': Four border patrol police officers were hospitalized in the town of Narathiwat in the south when a remote-controlled bomb exploded near their vehicle.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Constant|first1=Max|title=Bomb injures 4 police officers in Thailand’s south|url=http://aa.com.tr/en/asia-pacific/bomb-injures-4-police-officers-in-thailand-s-south/704361|accessdate=13 March 2017|agency=Anadolu|date=2016-12-12}}</ref>
'''15 December''': A villager was shot dead in Thailand's Muslim south in [[Songkhla Province]] in [[Saba Yoi District]], as he was preparing to harvest rubber sap at his plantation.{{cn|date=March 2017}}
'''30 December''': A car bombing and a shooting, militants ambushed the car of a 51-year-old villager who was driving along a local road, have shaken Thailand's majority Muslim south, local authorities in [[Su-ngai Padi District]], Narathiwat Province confirmed.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Constant|first1=Max|title=Bombing, shooting rock Thailand’s south|url=http://aa.com.tr/en/asia-pacific/bombing-shooting-rock-thailand-s-south/716854|accessdate=11 March 2017|agency=[[Anadolu Agency|Anadolu]]|date=2016-12-30}}</ref>
=== 2017 ===
* '''2 March''' - Four members of a family were killed including an eight-year-old boy and two other children wounded in an ambush in Narathiwat Province. The assailants fled the scene.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Harai|first1=Waedao|title=Family of four ambushed, slain in Narathiwat|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/crime/1207712/family-of-four-slain-in-narathiwat|accessdate=11 March 2017|work=Bangkok Post|date=2 March 2017}}</ref> * '''3 March''' - Three Thai soldiers were gunned down at a busy evening market by suspected militants in Mayo District of Pattani Province.<ref>{{cite news|title=Three soldiers killed in day of bloodshed in Thai south|url=http://www.nationmultimedia.com/news/national/30307829|accessdate=11 March 2017|work=The Nation|agency=Agence-France Presse|date=3 March 2017}}</ref> A security guard was shot dead in Ban Buketkong village of tambon Lubo Yirai.<ref name=BP-20170313>{{cite news|last1=Charoenpo|first1=Anucha|title=Special power not needed for the South|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/opinion/opinion/1213629/special-power-not-needed-for-the-south|accessdate=13 March 2017|work=Bangkok Post|date=13 March 2017|format=Editorial}}</ref> A group representing 300 Buddhist leaders and activists in the south called on the prime minister, as leader of the [[National Council for Peace and Order]] (NCPO), to invoke Section 44 of the interim charter to tackle the insurgency in the provinces of Yala, Pattani, and Narathiwat.<ref name=BP-20170313/> * '''29 March''' - A gunfight occurred after a pickup truck tried to escape from a police checkpoint and its passengers began shooting at officers. The police fired back, killing two people. The two dead were suspected of being responsible for an attack in early March that killed four people.<ref name="BP-20170331">{{cite news|title=Ranger, policeman shot dead in deep South|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/1224052/ranger-policeman-shot-dead-in-deep-south|accessdate=31 March 2017|work=Bangkok Post|agency=Associated Press|date=31 March 2017}}</ref> * '''30 March''' - ** One police officer was killed and four or five others were injured in a drive-by shooting by militants in the [[Ra-ngae District]] of Narathiwat Province.<ref>{{cite news|title=One police killed, 4 injured in drive-by shooting|url=http://englishnews.thaipbs.or.th/one-police-killed-4-injured-drive-shooting/|accessdate=30 March 2017|work=Thai PBS|date=30 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Benjakat|first1=Abdulloh|title=Policeman slain, five injured in drive-by shooting|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/general/1224244/policeman-slain-five-injured-in-drive-by-shooting|accessdate=31 March 2017|work=Bangkok Post|date=31 March 2017}}</ref> ** The body of army ranger, Saifru Hasimae, was found in Yala Province. No motive for his killing has been established.<ref name="BP-20170331"/> ** Separately, five gunmen opened fire on a police station in Narathiwat Province, killing a policeman and wounding three others. Pol Col Surapong Chatsuth said the attack appeared to be retaliation for a gun battle on 29 March at a police checkpoint that resulted in the deaths of two gunmen.<ref name="BP-20170331"/> * '''3 April''' - At least twenty insurgents attack a security checkpoint during the early hours in [[Krong Pinang District]], Yala Province which wounds twelve police officers. The Runda Kumpulan Kecil (RKK) insurgent group were suspected behind the attack.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/1226400/12-police-hurt-in-yala-bomb-gun-attack|title=12 police hurt in Yala bomb, gun attack|publisher=Bangkok Post|date=4 April 2017}}</ref> * '''20 April''' - Two insurgents were killed after a bomb they were transporting prematurely exploded, the military said. Among the dead are insurgent operation leaders.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/04/killed-bomb-blast-thailand-restive-south-170420044946161.html|title=Two killed in bomb blast in Thailand's restive south|publisher=Al Jazeera|date=20 April 2017}}</ref>
* '''6 May''' - A border patrol police officer was wounded in a roadside bomb blast near the Sungai Kolok River in Tak Bai district, authorities said.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/1244723/blast-wounds-narathiwat-officer|title=Narathiwat blast wounds border patrol officer|publisher=Post Publishing}}</ref> * '''9 May''' - [[2017 Pattani bombing]]: Sixty people were confirmed injured when two bombs went off at Big C Supercenter in Muang district. A canvas vendor was killed before his truck was stolen to be used as the bomb delivery system.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.9news.com.au/world/2017/05/10/05/21/thailand-bomb-injures-56|title=Children among 51 injured after Thailand car bomb|publisher=}}</ref> * '''22 May''' - A small bomb struck military-run [[Phramongkutklao Hospital]] in Bangkok, wounding more than 20 people.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asiapacific/bomb-wounds-20-at-bangkok-military-hospital-police-8871298|title=Bomb wounds 21 at Bangkok military hospital|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/22/world/asia/thailand-bangkok-hospital-bomb-blast.html|title=Bangkok Hospital Bombing Wounds 24 on Anniversary of Thai Coup|first1=Ryn|last1=Jirenuwat|first2=Gerry|last2=Mullany|date=22 May 2017|publisher=|via=NYTimes.com}}</ref> * '''23 May''' - Attackers in southern Thailand fatally shot two army rangers at close range Tuesday, police said, the latest killings in a region that has been plagued by a long-running Muslim separatist insurgency.<ref>https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/2-army-rangers-killed-in-troubled-southern-thailand/2017/05/23/e5a39488-3f9f-11e7-b29f-f40ffced2ddb_story.html</ref>
* '''19 June''' - Six soldiers were killed and four wounded when a bomb planted on a dirt road in Pattani province exploded.<ref>{{cite web|title=6 Soldiers Killed in Bomb Blast in Southern Thailand|url=https://www.voanews.com/a/six-soldiers-killed-in-bomb-blast-thailand/3906135.html|website=Voice of America|date=19 June 2017|accessdate=19 June 2017}}</ref>
* '''15 July''' - Two policeman and one civilian were wounded after a motorcycles bomb exploded on Ban Pupor bridge in Narathiwat as a police petrol was acrossing the bridge.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/1287674/narathiwat-bike-bomb-wounds-three|title=Narathiwat bike bomb wounds three|website=Bangkok Post|date=15 July 2017|accessdate=2 January 2018}}</ref>
* '''20 July''' - A policeman was killed and another seriously wounded when a police checkpoint in Narathiwat’s Bacho district was attacked with pipe bombs.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://englishnews.thaipbs.or.th/pipe-bomb-attack-kills-one-policeman-wounds-another-narathiwat/|title=Pipe bomb attack kills one policeman, wounds another in Narathiwat|date=20 July 2017|website=Thai PBS English News|accessdate=2 January 2018}}</ref>
* '''17 August''' - A car dealership was raided by militants and five stolen cars turned into bombs in Songkhla’s Na Thawi district. Four employees were taken hostage and one of them shot dead.<ref name="nation aug 17">{{cite news|title=Two killed in hostage drama in deep South|url=http://www.nationmultimedia.com/detail/national/30324026|accessdate=3 March 2018|work= The Nation|agency=|date=17 August 2017}}</ref>
* '''14 September''' - Two soldiers died and 27 other people were wounded, including two civilians, as suspected rebels ambushed an army patrol in Thailand’s violence-stricken deep south.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.scmp.com/news/asia/southeast-asia/article/2111184/one-dead-20-wounded-after-rebel-ambush-southern-thailand|title=Two dead, 27 wounded after rebel ambush in southern Thailand|website=South China Morning Post|date=14 September 2017|accessdate=2 January 2018}}</ref>
=== 2018 === * '''22 January''' – Three people were killed and 22 wounded when a [[motorcycle bomb]] exploded in the pork-selling area of Pimolchai market in Yala Province's Muang district. According to local police, a young man parked the motorcycle near a pork stall in the early morning and left.<ref>{{cite news|title=Bomb at pork stall in market in Thailand's south kills three, wounds 22|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-thailand-south-bomb/bomb-at-pork-stall-in-market-in-thailands-south-kills-three-wounds-22-idUSKBN1FB05M|accessdate=24 February 2018|work=Reuters|date=22 January 2018}}</ref> * '''6 February''' – A defence volunteer, a school-mum and a young student were wounded when a bomb exploded near a school in Yala’s Yaha district.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/1408386/defence-volunteer-woman-schoolgirl-hurt-by-yala-bomb|title=Defence volunteer, woman, schoolgirl hurt by Yala bomb|date=6 February 2018|website=Bangkok Post|accessdate=4 March 2018}}</ref> * '''11 February''' – Six bomb blasts in the Pattani province left nine people, including the Yaring district chief, injured.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bangkokpost.com/news/security/1410694/six-pattani-blasts-prompt-chinese-new-year-fears|title=Six Pattani blasts prompt Chinese New Year fears|website=Bangkok Post|date=12 February 2018|accessdate=4 March 2018}}</ref> * '''15 February''' – Three female students and three local security volunteers were injured when a bomb exploded near a primary school in the Mueang Yala district in Yala province.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thesundaily.my/news/2018/02/15/six-including-students-injured-yala-bombing|title=Six, including students, injured in Yala bombing|website=The Sun Daily|date=15 February 2018|accessdate=4 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://thethaiger.com/news/muslim-paramilitary-soldiers-injured-yala-bomb-attack|title=Muslim paramilitary soldiers injured in Yala bomb attack|website=Phuket Gazette|date=15 February 2018|accessdate=29 September 2018}}</ref>
==Further reading== *{{cite book|last1=Gunaratna|first1=Rohan|last2=Acharya|first2=Arabinda|last3=Chua|first3=Sabrina|title=Conflict and Terrorism in Southern Thailand.|date=2005|publisher=Marshall Cavendish International, 2005.|location=Singapore|pages=160–163|edition=Paper}}

page.title: Timeline of the war in Donbass (July–September 2018)

revision.comment: [[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]], [[WP:AWB/T|typo(s) fixed]]: Int he → In the, secton → section, repectively → respectively, ukrainian → Ukrainian
revision.text:
{{About||the events in general|Timeline of the war in Donbass}} {{Use British English|date=July 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2018}} [[File:Map of the war in Donbass.svg|thumb|right]] This is a '''timeline of the [[War in Donbass]]''', from 1 July 2018. The timeline follows an ongoing conflict between Ukraine and anti-government pro-Russian separatists supported by [[Russia]] in the [[Donbass|Donbass region]] in eastern [[Ukraine]]. {{TOC limit|2}} == July == === 1 July === The press-centre of the Joint Forces Operation (JFO) reported in the morning that pro-Russian forces had opened fire on 26 occasions on Ukrainian positions on the last day of June{{cite web|url=http://www.mil.gov.ua/news/2018/07/01/zvedennya-shhodo-obstanovki-v-rajoni-provedennya-operaczii-obednanih-sil-stanom-na-07-00-01-lipnya-2018-roku/ |title=Зведення щодо обстановки в районі проведення операції Об’єднаних сил станом на 07.00 01 липня 2018 року |trans-title= |date=1 July 2018 |accessdate=1 July 2018 |publisher=[[Ministry of Defence (Ukraine)|MoD]] |language=uk}} (including on 20 occasions in [[Donetsk Oblast|Donetsk region]] and on 6 occasions in [[Luhansk Oblast|Luhansk region]]); the fire was returned on 9 occasions. By the morning of 1 July two [[ceasefire]] violations were registered with no casualties on the Ukrainian side; the fire was not returned. The spokesman of the [[Ministry of Defence (Ukraine)|Ministry of Defence]] confirmed at noon that one Ukrainian serviceman was [[Wounded in action|wounded]] in the [[Donbass|Donbass region]] on the last day of June.{{cite web|url=http://mediarnbo.org/2018/07/01/oos-svodnyie-dannyie-01-iyulya-2018/?lang=ru |title=ООС: сводные данные – 01 июля 2018 |trans-title=JFO – Summary information as of 1 July 2018|date=1 July 2018 |accessdate=1 July 2018 |publisher=[[National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine|NSDC]] |language=ru |website=mediarnbo.org|quote=Posted By: Galat 13:13 01/07/2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.unian.info/war/10170890-new-truce-in-donbas-fails-as-russian-controlled-troops-mount-two-attacks-on-ukrainian-army.html |publisher=[[Ukrainian Independent Information Agency|UNIAN]]|title=New truce in Donbas fails as Russian-controlled troops mount two attacks on Ukrainian army {{!}} One Ukrainian soldier was wounded in action as a result of hostilities on June 30.|date=1 July 2018 |accessdate=1 July 2018}} Pro-Russian sources from the self-proclaimed [[Donetsk People's Republic]] reported four Ukrainian violations of the new ceasefire in four different locations using small arms, [[AGS-17|automatic grenade launchers]], [[SPG-9|73 antitank recoilless rifles]], 82 mm mortars, armoured personnel carriers and armoured fighting vehicles.{{Cite web|url=https://dnr-online.ru/vsu-chetyre-raza-otkryvali-ogon-po-territorii-respubliki-stskk/|title=ВСУ четыре раза открывали огонь по территории Республики - СЦКК|last=|first=|date=1 July 2018|website=Официальный сайт ДНР|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=1 July 2018}} According to local authorities, Ukrainian forces broke the ceasefire two times inside the territory of the self-proclaimed [[Luhansk People's Republic]]. The Ukrainian military attacked pro-Russian troops at Donetskyi and Lozove with small arms, automatic grenade launchers, [[RPG-7|antitank rocket launchers]], 120 mm mortars and [[BMP-1]] armoured vehicles.{{Cite web|url=https://goves.net/news/2234-operativnaja-svodka-ot-narodnoi-milicii-lnr-za-proshedshie-sutki-01-07-2017.html|title=Оперативная сводка от Народной милиции ЛНР за прошедшие сутки 01.07.2018|website=Социальная сеть Новороссии GOVES|access-date=2018-07-02}} According to the information provided by the press-centre of the JFO headquarters in the evening pro-Russian forces had opened fire on positions of Ukrainian troops on 7 occasions between 7:00 am and 6:00 pm, no casualties were reported.{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/pressjfo.news/posts/401233473702608 |title=Операція об'єднаних сил / Joint forces operation {{!}} ЗВЕДЕННЯ СТАНОМ НА 18:00 01 ЛИПНЯ 2018 РОКУ |trans-title= |date=1 July 2018 |accessdate=1 July 2018 |publisher=Press-centre of the JFO HQ |language=uk}} By the end of the day a total of 25 ceasefire violations were registered with no casualties on the Ukrainian side. In the region of [[Mariupol]], [[Vodiane, Volnovakha Raion|Vodiane]], [[Hnutove]] and [[Shyrokyne]] became the target of small arms, heavy machine guns, automatic grenade launchers and antitank rocket launchers. In the northern section of the demarcation line, [[Zaitseve]] and Troitske came under 82 mm and 120 mm mortar fire. Several civilian buildings were damaged at Zaitseve. Pro-Russian armoured fighting vehicles from [[Holmivskyi|Holmivsky]] engaged Ukrainian forces at [[Hladosove]]. The separatists attacked Ukrainian positions at [[Shchastya]], [[Luhanske, Bakhmut Raion|Luhanske]], [[Krymske, Novoaidar Raion|Krymske]], [[Svitlodarsk]] and [[Novooleksandrivka, Popasna Raion|Novooleksandrivka]] with small arms, heavy machine guns and rocket launchers.{{cite web|url=http://www.mil.gov.ua/news/2018/07/02/zvedennya-shhodo-obstanovki-v-rajoni-provedennya-operaczii-obednanih-sil-stanom-na-07-00-02-lipnya-2018-roku/ |title=Зведення щодо обстановки в районі проведення операції Об’єднаних сил станом на 07.00 02 липня 2018 року |trans-title= |date=2 July 2018 |accessdate=2 July 2018 |publisher=MoD |language=uk}}{{cite web|url=https://www.unian.info/war/10171364-jfo-ukraine-reports-25-enemy-attacks-in-last-day.html |publisher=UNIAN|title=JFO: Ukraine reports 25 enemy attacks in last day {{!}} No casualties among Ukrainian troops have been reported over the past day.|date=2 July 2018 |accessdate=2 July 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-defense/2490715-militants-violated-ceasefire-in-eastern-ukraine-25-times-in-last-day.html |publisher=[[Ukrinform]] |title=Militants violated ceasefire in eastern Ukraine 25 times in last day |date=2 July 2018 |accessdate=2 July 2018}} Pro-Russian authorities at Donetsk city told the press that the Ukrainian military broke the ceasefire on a number of occasions throughout the day. In the main incidents, two antitank missiles fired from [[Slavne]] destroyed a [[Kamaz]] water supply truck at Signalne, in the region of Mariupol. The driver died of his wounds.{{Cite web|url=https://dnr-online.ru/vsu-obstrelyali-poselok-signalnoe-stskk/|title=ВСУ обстреляли поселок Сигнальное - СЦКК|last=|first=|date=1 July 2018|website=Официальный сайт ДНР|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=1 July 2018}}{{Cite web|url=https://dnr-online.ru/vsu-razbili-raketami-kamaz-kotoryj-vez-vodu-stskk/|title=ВСУ разбили ракетами "КамАЗ", который вез воду - СЦКК|last=|first=|date=1 July 2018|website=Официальный сайт ДНР|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=1 July 2018}}{{Cite news|url=https://news-front.info/2018/07/02/vsu-obstrelyali-dokuchaevsk-i-signalnoe-v-dnr/|title=ВСУ обстреляли Докучаевск и Сигнальное в ДНР|work=News Front - Новостной Фронт. Новости Мира России Украины|access-date=2018-07-02|language=ru-RU}} In the surroundings of [[Donetsk City|Donetsk city]], [[BMP-2]] armoured fighting vehicles engaged pro-Russian positions at [[Dokuchaievsk]].{{Cite web|url=https://dnr-online.ru/vsu-narushili-hlebnoe-peremirie-stskk/|title=ВСУ нарушили "хлебное" перемирие - СЦКК|last=|first=|date=1 July 2018|website=Официальный сайт ДНР|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=1 July 2018}} Two civilian residences were heavily damaged.{{Cite web|url=https://dnr-online.ru/v-dokuchaevske-povrezhdeny-doma-po-ul-lenina-i-tsentralnaya-stskk/|title=В Докучаевске повреждены дома по ул. Ленина и Центральная - СЦКК|last=|first=|date=|website=Официальный сайт ДНР|archive-url=|archive-date=1 July 2018|dead-url=|access-date=1 July 2018}} Officials from the self-proclaimed Luhansk People's Republic reported two Ukrainian violations of the truce by evening. BMP-1 armoured vehicles attacked pro-Russian positions at [[Slovianoserbsk]] supported by small arms and 82 mm mortar fire, while Kalynivka became the target of heavy machine guns and grenade launchers.{{Cite news|url=https://news-front.info/2018/07/01/v-lnr-zayavili-o-sryve-peremiriya-ukrainskimi-boevikami/|title=В ЛНР заявили о срыве перемирия украинскими боевиками|work=News Front - Новостной Фронт. Новости Мира России Украины|access-date=2018-07-01|language=ru-RU}} The press-centre of the [[Ministry of Defence (Ukraine)|Ministry of Defence]] reported the following casualties during the past week (the 26th week of 2018, from Monday the 25th of June to Sunday the 1st of July): eight Ukrainian soldiers were killed in action and twelve were wounded.{{cite web|url=http://www.mil.gov.ua/en/news/2018/07/02/briefing-ministry-of-defence-of-ukraine-spokesperson-on-frontline-situation/ |title=Briefing Ministry of Defence of Ukraine spokesperson on frontline situation|date=2018-07-02 |accessdate=2018-07-02 |publisher=2018-07-02 |quote= |first1= |last1= |location= }} === 2 July === According to the information provided by the press-centre of the JFO headquarters in the morning pro-Russian forces had opened fire on 25 occasions on Ukrainian positions the previous day (including on 9 occasions in Donetsk region and on 16 occasions in Luhansk region); the fire was returned twice. By the morning of 2 July four ceasefire violations were registered with no casualties on the Ukrainian side; the fire was not returned.
